alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Holt (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 12 at 2:10PM CST until December 15 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Boyd, Rock, Blaine, Logan, Perkins, Lincoln, and Chase Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on very slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A sharp gradient in snow totals is expected with this storm system as higher snowfall totals occur to the west and much more rain and mixed precipitation will occur to the east.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
